intro: Chamaesaracha felgeri, commonly known as the Felger's chamaesaracha, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
